explanation: The report is not correct. The function shown (OS_Posix_QueueAPI_Impl_Init) contains no switch/default at all, so the alleged violation does not apply to that function. The default: break; text referenced by Agent A appears in other functions (OS_API_Impl_Init / OS_API_Init). Even for those switches, a plain default: break; is either unreachable for the caller sequence shown (the loop in OS_API_Init iterates only over valid idtype values that are handled by explicit cases), in which case it is unreachable (note 2 of Rule 2.2: unreachable code is not dead code), or if it were reachable it would merely be a no-op placeholder. To claim a Rule 2.2 violation you must show an operation that is actually executed at runtime and whose removal would not affect program behaviour. That is not demonstrated here. Therefore the agent A report is incorrect.
